greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Run Length Transform of Catalan numbers A000108.
comment: The Run Length Transform of a sequence {S(n), n>=0} is defined to be the sequence {T(n), n>=0} given by T(n) = Product_i S(i), where i runs through the lengths of runs of 1's in the binary expansion of n. E.g. 19 is 10011 in binary, which has two runs of 1's, of lengths 1 and 2. So T(19) = S(1)*S(2). T(0)=1 (the empty product).
link: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..8192
Index entries for sequences computed with run length transform
example: Written as an irregular triangle in which row lengths are the terms of A011782:
Right border gives the Catalan numbers. This is simply a restatement of the theorem that this sequence is the Run Length Transform of A000108.
maple: for n from 0 to 100 do lis:=[]; t1:=convert(n, base, 2); L1:=nops(t1); out1:=1; c:=0;
for i from 1 to L1 do
if out1 = 1 and t1[i] = 1 then out1:=0; c:=c+1;
elif out1 = 0 and t1[i] = 1 then c:=c+1;
elif out1 = 1 and t1[i] = 0 then c:=c;
elif out1 = 0 and t1[i] = 0 then lis:=[c, op(lis)]; out1:=1; c:=0;
if i = L1 and c>0 then lis:=[c, op(lis)]; fi;
mathematica: f = CatalanNumber; Table[Times @@ (f[Length[#]]&) /@ Select[ Split[ IntegerDigits[n, 2]], #[[1]] == 1&], {n, 0, 87}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 11 2017 *)
program: return reduce(mul,(c[len(d)] for d in split('0+',s))) if n > 0 else 1
A246596_list = lambda len: RLT(lambda n: binomial(2*n, n)/(n+1), len)
(define (A246596 n) (fold-left (lambda (a r) (* a (A000108 r))) 1 (bisect (reverse (binexp->runcount1list n)) (- 1 (modulo n 2)))))
;; Note: EIGEN-CONVOLUTION can be found from my IntSeq-library and other functions are as in A227349. - _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 08 2014
